children.text: pāpaṃ na kuryān manasā na vācā kāyena vā kiṃcana sarvaloke /
children.translated_text: One should not commit sin by mind, speech, or body in the entire world;

children.text: riktaḥ kāmaiḥ smṛtimān saṃprajānaṃ duḥkhaṃ na seveta anarthasaṃhitam // Śag_1.1
children.translated_text: Being devoid of desires, mindful, and aware, one should not engage in suffering connected with misfortune.

children.text: ākhyeyasaṃjñinaḥ satvā ākhyeye 'smin pratiṣṭhitāḥ /
children.translated_text: Beings identified with the name are established in this name;

children.text: ākhyeyam aparijñāya yogam āyānti mṛtyunaḥ // Śag_2.1
children.translated_text: Not knowing the name, they come to the <s>Yoga</s> of death.

children.text: ākhyeyaṃ tu parijñāya ākhyātāraṃ na manyate /
children.translated_text: But knowing the name, they do not consider the speaker;

children.text: tad vai na vidyate tasya vadeyur yena taṃ pare // Śag_2.2
children.translated_text: That indeed does not exist of which others would speak of him.

children.text: samo viśeṣa uta vāpi hīno yo manyate sa vivadeta tena /
children.translated_text: Whether equal, superior, or inferior, one who thinks thus debates with him;

children.text: vidhātraye 'smin na vikampate yaḥ samo viśiṣṭaś ca na tasya bhavati // Śag_2.3
children.translated_text: In this triad of creators, he who does not waver, neither equal nor superior belongs to him.

children.text: ācchidya tṛṣṇām iha nāmarūpe prahāya mānaṃ ca na saṃgam eti /
children.translated_text: Having cut off craving here in name and form, having abandoned pride, he does not come to attachment;

children.text: taṃ śāntadhūmam anighaṃ nirāśaṃ nādrākṣus te devamanuṣyaloke /
children.translated_text: Him, with tranquil smoke, free from distress, without hope, they have not seen in the world of gods and men,

children.text: iha bāhirataś ca // Śag_2.4
children.translated_text: here and beyond.

children.text: kāmarāgābhibhūtatvāc cittaṃ me paridahyate /
children.translated_text: Overcome by desire and passion, my mind is burning;

children.text: aṃga me gautama brūhi śāntiṃ tvam anukaṃpayā // Śag_3.1
children.translated_text: O <s>Gautama</s>, tell me the peace out of compassion.

children.text: viparyāsena saṃjñānāṃ cittaṃ te paridahyate /
children.translated_text: Due to the distortion of perceptions, your mind is burning;

children.text: nimittaṃ varjyatāṃ tasmāc chubhaṃ rāgopasaṃhitaṃ // Śag_3.2
children.translated_text: Therefore, avoid the cause associated with auspicious passion.

children.text: aśubhāṃ bhāvaya sadā tvam ekāgraḥ susamāhitaḥ /
children.translated_text: Always cultivate the inauspicious, being single-minded and well-composed;

children.text: nirvāpayāśu rāgāgniṃ dahyase mā punaḥ punaḥ // Śag_3.3
children.translated_text: Extinguish quickly the fire of passion, do not burn again and again.

children.text: saṃskārāvaratāṃ paśya duḥkhato 'nātmatas tathā /
children.translated_text: See the obscuration of <s>saṃskāras</s> as painful and non-self;

children.text: smṛtiṃ kāyagatāṃ kṛtvā nirvedabahulo bhava // Śag_3.4
children.translated_text: Establish mindfulness on the body and be abundant in dispassion.

children.text: bhāvyatām animittaṃ ca mānānuśayanāśanaṃ /
children.translated_text: Cultivate the signless and the destruction of pride and latent tendencies;

children.text: tato mānābhisamayād duḥkhasyāntaṃ kariṣyasi // Śag_3.5
children.translated_text: Then, through the understanding of pride, you will make an end of suffering.

children.text: kumārikāpraśnagāthā:
children.translated_text: The Verses of the Questions of the Maiden:

children.text: kathaṃvihārabahulo bhikṣuḥ pañcaughatīrṇas taratīha ṣaṣṭhaṃ /
children.translated_text: How does a monk, abundant in dwelling, cross over the five floods here to the sixth?

children.text: kathaṃdhyāyī vipulāṃ kāmatṛṣṇāṃ tīrṇo bhavaty apratilabdhayoktraḥ // Śag_4.1
children.translated_text: How does one, meditating, cross over the vast craving for desire, becoming unrestrained?

body.text: praśrabdhakāyaḥ suvimuktacitto hy asaṃskurvan smṛtimān akopyaḥ

children.text: ājñāya dharmam avitarkadhyāyī kopaspṛhāstyānadoṣaiḥ viyuktaḥ // Śag_4.2
children.translated_text: Having understood the <s>Dharma</s>, meditating without thought, free from anger, desire, and sloth.

children.text: evaṃvihārabahulo bhikṣuḥ pañcaughatīrṇas taratīha ṣaṣṭhaṃ /
children.translated_text: Thus, a monk abundant in dwelling crosses over the five floods here to the sixth;

children.text: evaṃdhyāyī vipulāṃ kāmatṛṣṇāṃ tīrṇo bhavaty apratilabdhayoktraḥ // Śag_4.3
children.translated_text: Thus, one meditating crosses over the vast craving for desire, becoming unrestrained.

body.translated_text: With a tranquil body, a well-liberated mind, not fabricating, mindful and unshakable,

children.text: nityotrasto hy ayaṃ loko nityodvignā iyaṃ prajā /
children.translated_text: This world is always fearful, these beings are always anxious;

children.text: anutpanneṣu duḥkheṣu samutpanneṣu vā punaḥ /
children.translated_text: In sufferings not arisen or arisen again;

children.text: yadi kiṃcid anutrastaṃ pṛṣṭa ācakṣva tan mama // Śag_5.1
children.translated_text: If there is anything fearless, tell me that when asked.

children.text: nānyatra jñānatapaso nānyatrendriyanigrahāt /
children.translated_text: There is no liberation other than through knowledge and austerity, other than through control of the senses;

children.text: nānyatra sarvasaṃtyāgān mokṣaṃ paśyāmi devate // Śag_5.2
children.translated_text: I see no liberation other than through the renunciation of all, O deity.

children.text: cirasya bata paśyāmi brāhmaṇaṃ parinirvṛtaṃ /
children.translated_text: For a long time, indeed, I see a <s>Brāhmaṇa</s> completely liberated;

children.text: sarvavairabhayātītaṃ tīrṇaṃ loke viṣaktikām // Śag_5.3
children.translated_text: Surpassed all enmity and fear, crossed over the world of attachment and desire.

children.text: kenābhivarṇā janatā praṇītā mārgaś ca nairyāṇikataḥ prayuktaḥ /
children.translated_text: By whom are the people described and guided, and the path directed towards liberation?

children.text: kutra sthitaḥ kutra ca śikṣamāṇo nāyaṃ martyaḥ paralokād bibheti // Śag_6.1
children.translated_text: Where established, and where learning, does this mortal not fear the other world?

children.text: yaḥ śīlavāñ jñānavān bhāvitātmā samāhitaḥ smṛtimān ṛjugataś ca /
children.translated_text: Who is virtuous, wise, cultivated in self, composed, mindful, and straightforward in conduct;

children.text: sarve 'sya śokajvarathāḥ prahīṇāḥ samyaksmṛto yasya cittaṃ vimuktaṃ // Śag_6.2
children.translated_text: All his sorrows and fevers are abandoned, whose mind is truly liberated with right mindfulness.

children.text: tenābhivarṇā janatā praṇītā mārgaś ca nairyāṇikataḥ prayuktaḥ /
children.translated_text: By him, the people are described and guided, and the path directed towards liberation.

children.text: atra sthitaḥ atra ca śikṣamāṇo nāyaṃ martyaḥ paralokād bibheti // Śag_6.3
children.translated_text: Established here, and learning here, this mortal does not fear the other world.

children.text: kathaṃ yaśasvī bhavati kathaṃ bhavati bhogavān /
children.translated_text: How does one become renowned, how does one become prosperous?

children.text: kathaṃ kīrtim avāpnoti kathaṃ mitrāṇi vindati // Śag_7.1
children.translated_text: How does one gain fame, how does one find friends?

children.text: śīlād yaśasvī bhavati dānād bhavati bhogavān /
children.translated_text: Through virtue, one becomes renowned; through charity, one becomes prosperous;

children.text: satyena kīrtim āpnoti dadan mitrāṇi vindati // Śag_7.2
children.translated_text: Through truth, one gains fame; by giving, one finds friends.

children.text: kutaḥ sarā nivartante kutra vartma na vartate /
children.translated_text: From where do streams return, where does the path not continue?

children.text: kutra duḥkhasukhaṃ loke niḥśeṣam uparudhyate // Śag_8.1
children.translated_text: Where in the world is all pleasure and pain completely obstructed?

children.text: cakṣuḥ śrotraṃ tathā ghrāṇaṃ jihvā kāyo manas tathā /
children.translated_text: The eye, ear, as well as nose, tongue, body, and mind;

children.text: yatra nāma ca rūpaṃ ca niḥśeṣam uparuhyate // Śag_8.2
children.translated_text: Where name and form are completely obstructed.

children.text: tataḥ sarā nivartante tatra vartma na vartate /
children.translated_text: From there streams return, there the path does not continue;

children.text: tatra duḥkhasukhaṃ loke niḥśeṣam uparudhyate // Śag_8.3
children.translated_text: There, in the world, all pleasure and pain are completely obstructed.

children.text: kena svid oghaṃ tarati kenottarati cārṇavaṃ /
children.translated_text: By what does one cross the flood, by what does one ascend the ocean?

children.text: duḥkhaṃ tyajati kena svit kena svit pariśudhyati // Śag_9.1
children.translated_text: By what does one abandon suffering, by what does one become purified?

children.text: śraddhayā tarati hy ogham apramādena cārṇavaṃ /
children.translated_text: By faith, one crosses the flood, by vigilance, the ocean;

children.text: vīryeṇa duḥkhaṃ tyajati prajñayā pariśudhyati // Śag_9.2
children.translated_text: By energy, one abandons suffering, by wisdom, one becomes purified.

children.text: ka etam oghaṃ tarati rātriṃdivam atandritaḥ /
children.translated_text: Who crosses this flood, untiring day and night?

children.text: anālambe 'pratiṣṭhe ca ko gaṃbhīre na sīdati // Śag_10.1
children.translated_text: Who, without support and foundation, does not sink in the deep?

children.text: sarvataḥ śīlasaṃpannaḥ prajñāvān susamāhitaḥ /
children.translated_text: One endowed with virtue in all respects, wise, well-composed;

children.text: adhyātmacintī smṛtimāṃs taratīmaṃ sudustaraṃ // Śag_10.2
children.translated_text: Reflecting on the self, mindful, crosses this very difficult [flood].

children.text: viraktaḥ kāmasaṃjñābhyo rūpasaṃyojanātigaḥ /
children.translated_text: Dispassionate towards the perceptions of desire, beyond the bonds of form;

children.text: anālambe 'pratiṣṭhe ca sa gaṃbhīre na sīdati // Śag_10.3
children.translated_text: Without support and foundation, he does not sink in the deep.

children.text: rāgadveṣau bhagavan kinnidānāv aratiratī romaharṣaḥ kuto 'yam /
children.translated_text: O Blessed One, what is the cause of attachment and aversion, indifference and delight, whence is this?

children.text: kutaḥsamutthāś ca mano vitarkāḥ kumārakā dhātrīm ivāśrayante // Śag_11.1
children.translated_text: Whence do thoughts of the mind arise, adhering like children to a nurse?

children.text: snehajā ātmasaṃbhūtā nyagrodhaskandhakā yathā /
children.translated_text: Born of affection, self-arisen, like the branches of a banyan tree;

children.text: pṛthagviṣaktāḥ kāmeṣu mālutā vā latā vane // Śag_11.2
children.translated_text: Separately attached to desires, like creepers in the forest.

children.text: rāgaś ca dveṣaś ca itonidānāv aratiratī romaharṣaḥ ito 'yaṃ /
children.translated_text: Attachment and aversion have this cause, indifference and delight have this origin;

children.text: itaḥsamutthāś ca mano vitarkāḥ kumārakā dhātrīm ivāśrayante // Śag_11.3
children.translated_text: From here arise thoughts of the mind, adhering like children to a nurse.

children.text: ye tān prajānanti yatonidānāṃs te tāṃ janā yakṣa vinodayanti /
children.translated_text: Those who know these causes, O Yakṣa, those people remove them;

children.text: ta arṇavaṃ saṃpratarantīhaugham atīrṇapūrvam apunarbhavāya // Śag_11.4
children.translated_text: They cross the ocean, the flood never crossed before, for non-return.

children.text: kāryam etad brāhmaṇena prahāṇam akilāsinā /
children.translated_text: This is the task of a <s>Brāhmaṇa</s>, to abandon with diligence;

children.text: kāmānāṃ viprahāṇārthaṃ na hi kāṃkṣaty asau bhavaṃ // Śag_12.1
children.translated_text: For the sake of abandoning desires, he does not long for existence.

body.text: sa kāryaṃ brāhmaṇasyāsti kṛtārtho brāhmaṇaḥ smṛtaḥ // Śag_12.2
body.translated_text: This is the task of the <s>Brāhmaṇa</s>, he is considered accomplished.

children.text: yāvan na gādhaṃ labhate na tīram āyūhate sarvagātraiḥ sa tāvat /
children.translated_text: As long as he does not reach the depth, he strives with all limbs;

children.text: tīraṃ tu labdhveha saṃtiṣṭhati sthale nāyūhate pāragato nirucyate // Śag_12.3
children.translated_text: Having reached the shore, he stands firm, does not strive, is called one who has gone beyond.

children.text: eṣopamā dāmale brāhmaṇasya kṣīṇāsravo yo nipako dhyānalābhī /
children.translated_text: This is the simile, O Dāmali, of the <s>Brāhmaṇa</s> whose defilements are exhausted, who is wise, attaining meditation;

children.text: sarve 'sya śokajvarathāḥ prahīṇāḥ samyaksmṛto yasya cittaṃ vimuktam // Śag_12.4
children.translated_text: All his sorrows and fevers are abandoned, whose mind is truly liberated with right mindfulness.

body.text:
geya:
bhikṣo bhikṣo ogham atārṣīḥ /
āma devate /
anālambe 'pratiṣṭhe ogham atārṣīḥ /
āma devate /
yathā kathaṃ tvaṃ bhikṣo anālambe apratiṣṭhe ogham atārṣīḥ /
yathā yathāhaṃ devate āyūhāmi tathā tathā saṃsīdāmi / yathā yathā saṃsīdāmi tathā tathā saṃtiṣṭhe / yathā yathā saṃtiṣṭhe tathā tathā uhye / yathā yathāhaṃ devate nāyūhāmi tathā tathā na saṃsīdāmīti vistareṇa śuklapakṣo veditavya

children.text: ḥ
children.translated_text: ḥ

āma devate /
anālambe 'pratiṣṭhe ogham atārṣīḥ /

yathā yathāhaṃ devate āyūhāmi tathā tathā saṃsīdāmi / yathā yathā saṃsīdāmi tathā tathā saṃtiṣṭhe / yathā yathā saṃtiṣṭhe tathā tathā uhye / yathā yathāhaṃ devate nāyūhāmi tathā tathā na saṃsīdāmīti vistareṇa śuklapakṣo veditavya

children.text: kumārikāpraśnagāthā:
children.translated_text: The Verses of the Questions of the Maiden:

children.text: eko 'raṇye prasṛto dhyāyase tvaṃ vittād vihīna uta vā prārthayānaḥ /
children.translated_text: Alone in the forest, you meditate, are you deprived of wealth or desiring?

children.text: grāmasya vā kiṃcanāgo nv akārṣīḥ kasmāj janena na karoṣi sakhyaṃ
children.translated_text: Perhaps you have done something to the village, why do you not make friendship with people?

children.text: sakhyaṃ na saṃvidyate kena cit tava // Śag_14.1
children.translated_text: Friendship is not found with anyone of yours.

children.text: arthāprāptyā hṛdayasyeha śāntir jitveha senāṃ priyaśātarūpaṃ /
children.translated_text: Here, through the attainment of wealth, the heart finds peace, having conquered the army, the dear and charming form;

children.text: eko dhyāyī sukham asmy anvabhotsaṃ tasmād janena na karomi sakhyaṃ
children.translated_text: Alone, meditating, I am happy, content, therefore I do not make friendship with people;

children.text: sakhyaṃ na saṃvidyate kena cid mama // Śag_14.2
children.translated_text: Friendship is not found with anyone of mine.

children.text: anityā bata saṃskārā utpādavyayadharmiṇaḥ /
children.translated_text: Impermanent indeed are the <s>saṃskāras</s>, subject to arising and cessation;

children.text: utpadya hi nirudhyante teṣāṃ vyupaśamaḥ sukham // Śag_15 (cf. Uv 1.3)
children.translated_text: Having arisen, they are indeed extinguished, their cessation is bliss.

body.text:
apramādo 'mṛtapadaṃ pramādo mṛtyunaḥ padaṃ /
apramattā na mriyante pramattās tu sadā mṛtā

children.text: ḥ
children.translated_text: ḥ

children.text: vitarkapramathitasya dehinas tīvrarāgasya śubhānudarśinaḥ /
children.translated_text: For one agitated by thoughts, possessed of intense passion, seeing the pleasant;

children.text: bhūyas tṛṣṇā vivardhate sā gāḍhīkurute 'sya bandhanaṃ // Śag_17 (cf. Uv 3.1)
children.translated_text: Craving further increases, it strengthens their bondage.

children.text: dharmasthaṃ śīlasaṃpannaṃ hrīmantaṃ satyavādinaṃ /
children.translated_text: Established in <s>Dharma</s>, endowed with virtue, modest, speaking truth;

children.text: ātmanaḥ priyakartāraṃ taṃ janaḥ kurute priyaṃ // Śag_18 (cf. Uv 5.24)
children.translated_text: The people make dear the one who acts for the good of others.

children.text: yat pareṣūpanidhyāyet karma dṛṣṭveha pāpakam /
children.translated_text: Whatever evil action one sees in others here,

children.text: ātmanā tan na kurvīta karmabaddho hi pāpakaḥ // Śag_19 (cf. Uv 9.6)
children.translated_text: One should not do that oneself, for evil binds through action.

children.text: subhāṣitaṃ hy uttamam āhur āryāḥ priyaṃ vaden nāpriyaṃ tad dvitīyaṃ /
children.translated_text: The noble declare the well-spoken as excellent, speak what is pleasant, not unpleasant, that is second;

children.text: satyaṃ vaden nānṛtaṃ tat tṛtīyaṃ dharmaṃ vaden nādharmaṃ tat caturtham // Śag_20 (cf. Uv 8.11)
children.translated_text: Speak truth, not falsehood, that is third; speak <s>Dharma</s>, not adharma, that is fourth.

children.text: śraddhātha hrīḥ śīlam athāpi dānaṃ dharmā ime satpuruṣapraśastāḥ /
children.translated_text: Faith and modesty, virtue and also charity, these are the <s>Dharma</s> praised by the noble men;

children.text: etaṃ hi mārgaṃ divigaṃ vadanti etena vai gacchati devalokam // Śag_21 (cf. Uv 10.1)
children.translated_text: This is indeed said to be the path to the divine worlds, by this one goes to the world of the gods.

children.text: śrutvā dharmaṃ vijānāti śrutvā pāpān nivartate /
children.translated_text: Hearing the <s>Dharma</s>, one understands; hearing, one turns away from sins;

children.text: śrutvā anarthaṃ tyajati śrutvā prāpnoti nirvṛtim // Śag_22 (cf. Uv 22.6)
children.translated_text: Hearing, one abandons misfortune; hearing, one attains liberation.

children.text: ākāśasamo na lipyate indrakīlapratimo na kaṃpate /
children.translated_text: Like the sky, he is not tainted; like the Indra's post, he does not shake;

children.text: hrada iva samupetakardame saṃsāre ramate na paṇḍitaḥ // Śag_23 (cf. Uv 17.12)
children.translated_text: Like a pond filled with mud, the wise one does not delight in <s>saṃsāra</s>.

children.text: ye rūpeṇa pramiṇvanti māṃ ghoṣeṇānuyānti ca /
children.translated_text: Those who measure me by form and follow by sound,

children.text: cchandarāgavaśopetā na mā jānanti te janāḥ // Śag_24.1 (cf. Uv 22.12)
children.translated_text: Being under the sway of desire and passion, those people do not know me.

children.text: adhyātmaṃ ca vijānāti bahirdhā ca na paśyati /
children.translated_text: He knows the inner self and does not see the external;

children.text: adhyātmaphaladarśī yaḥ sa vai ghoṣeṇa nīyate // Śag_24.2 (cf. Uv 22.13)
children.translated_text: He who sees the fruit of the inner self is indeed led by sound.

children.text: adhyātmaṃ ca na jānāti bahirdhā ca vipaśyati /
children.translated_text: He does not know the inner self but sees the external;

children.text: bahirdhāphaladarśī yaḥ so 'pi ghoṣeṇa nīyate // Śag_24.3 (cf. Uv 22.14)
children.translated_text: He who sees the fruit of the external is also led by sound.

children.text: adhyātmaṃ ca na jānāti bahirdhā ca na paśyati /
children.translated_text: He neither knows the inner self nor sees the external;

children.text: samantāvaraṇo bālaḥ so 'pi ghoṣeṇa nīyate // Śag_24.4 (cf. Uv 22.15)
children.translated_text: The child, covered all around, is also led by sound.

children.text: adhyātmaṃ ca vijānāti bahirdhā ca vipaśyati /
children.translated_text: He knows the inner self and sees the external;

children.text: dhīro niḥsaraṇaprajño na sa ghoṣeṇa nīyate // Śag_24.5 (cf. Uv 22.16)
children.translated_text: The wise, with the knowledge of liberation, is not led by sound.

body.translated_text:
apramādo 'mṛtapadaṃ pramādo mṛtyunaḥ padaṃ /
apramattā na mriyante pramattās tu sadā mṛtā

children.text: ṣaṣṭhe adhipatau rājñi rajyamāne rajasvalaḥ /
children.translated_text: In the sixth, the sovereign king rules, being passionate;

children.text: arajasy arajā bhavati rakto bālo nirucyate // Śag_25 (cf. Uv 16.22)
children.translated_text: The non-passionate becomes non-passionate, the red child is declared.

children.text: nagaram asthiprākāraṃ snāyumāṃsānulepanaṃ /
children.translated_text: The city is a wall of bones, smeared with sinews and flesh;

children.text: yatra rāgaś ca dveṣaś ca māno mrakṣaś ca gāhate // Śag_26 (cf. Uv 16.23)
children.translated_text: Where attachment and aversion, pride and malice dwell.

children.text: kūrmaḥ svake 'ṅgāni yathā kapāle bhikṣur nidadhyān manaso vitarkāni /
children.translated_text: As a turtle draws its limbs into its shell, the monk should withdraw thoughts of the mind;

children.text: aniśrito 'nyān aviheṭhamānaḥ parinirvṛto nāpavadeta kaṃ cit // Śag_27 (cf. Uv 26.1)
children.translated_text: Not relying on others, not harming, fully liberated, he should not blame anyone.

children.text: tulyam atulyaṃ ca saṃbhavaṃ bhavasaṃskāram avāsṛjan muniḥ /
children.translated_text: The sage, indifferent to equal and unequal, not creating the formation of existence;

children.text: adhyātmarataḥ samāhita abhinat kośam ivāṇḍasaṃbhavaḥ // Śag_28 (cf. Uv 26.30)
children.translated_text: Delighting in the inner self, composed, he breaks the shell like the birth of an egg.

children.text: nāsti kāmasamaḥ paṃko nāsti dveṣasamo grahaḥ /
children.translated_text: There is no mire like desire, no seizure like aversion;

children.text: nāsti mohasamaṃ jālaṃ nāsti tṛṣṇāsamā nadī // Śag_29 (cf. Uv 29.37)
children.translated_text: There is no net like delusion, no river like craving.

children.text: ākāśe vai padaṃ nāsti śramaṇo nāsti bāhyakaḥ /
children.translated_text: In the sky, indeed, there is no footprint; there is no external ascetic;

children.text: prapañcābhiratā bālā niṣprapañcās tathāgatāḥ // Śag_30 (cf. Uv 29.38)
children.translated_text: Children delight in proliferation; the <s>Tathāgatas</s> are free from proliferation.

body.text: sthitiḥ prapaṃcāś ca na santi yasya yaḥ sa

children.text: ṃ
children.translated_text: ṃ

children.text: dānaṃ parighaṃ cātivṛttaḥ /
children.translated_text: dānaṃ parighaṃ cātivṛttaḥ /

children.text: taṃ nistṛṣṇaṃ muniṃ carantaṃ na vijānāti sadevako 'pi lokaḥ // Śag_31 (cf. Uv 29.51)
children.translated_text: That desireless sage, wandering, is not known by the world with its gods.

saṃgaṃ so 'tītya rūpasaṃjñā

children.text: caturyogāpagato na jātim eti // Śag_32 (cf. Uv 29.56)
children.translated_text: caturyogāpagato na jātim eti // Śag_32 (cf. Uv 29.56)

children.text: dadataḥ puṇyaṃ pravardhate vairaṃ saṃyamato na cīyate /
children.translated_text: For the giver, merit increases; from restraint, enmity does not accumulate;

children.text: kuśalī prajahāti pāpakaṃ kleśānāṃ kṣayatas tu nirvṛtaḥ // Śag_33 (cf. Uv 28.2)
children.translated_text: The skillful abandon evil, with the destruction of afflictions, they are liberated.

children.text: sarvapāpasyākaraṇaṃ kuśalasyopasaṃpadā /
children.translated_text: The non-doing of all evil, the cultivation of the skillful;

children.text: svacittaparyavadamanam etaṃ buddhānuśāsanaṃ // Śag_34 (cf. Uv 28.1)
children.translated_text: The purification of one's mind, this is the teaching of the <s>Buddhas</s>.

children.text: durnigrahasya laghuno yatrakāmanipātinaḥ /
children.translated_text: Of the difficult-to-control, light, wherever desire falls;

children.text: cittasya dāmanaṃ sādhu cittaṃ dāntaṃ sukhāvaham // Śag_35 (cf. Uv 31.1)
children.translated_text: The tamed mind is good, the disciplined mind brings happiness.

children.text: cittanimittasya kovidaḥ pravivekasya ca vindate rasaṃ /
children.translated_text: The one skilled in the signs of the mind finds the taste of solitude;

children.text: dhyāyī nipakaḥ pratismṛto bhuṃkte prītisukhaṃ nirāmiṣaṃ // Śag_36 (cf. Uv 31.51)
children.translated_text: The meditative, prudent, recollects and enjoys the bliss of joy without impurity.

children.translated_text: m ekacaram aśarīraṃ guhāśayaṃ /

children.text: damayati durdamaṃ cittaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ taṃ bravīmy ahaṃ // Śag_38 (cf. Uv 33.55)
children.translated_text: He tames the untamable mind, that <s>Brāhmaṇa</s> I declare.

children.text: pārāyaṇeṣv ajitapraśnaḥ:
children.translated_text: In the questions of the unconquered in the <s>Pārāyaṇa</s>:

children.text: kenāyaṃ nivṛto lokaḥ kenāyaṃ na prakāśate /
children.translated_text: By what is this world restrained, by what does it not shine;

children.text: kiṃ cābhilepanaṃ brūṣe kiṃ ca tasya mahad bhayam // Śag_39.1
children.translated_text: What do you call its covering, and what is its great fear?

children.text: avidyānivṛto lokaḥ pramādān na prakāśate /
children.translated_text: The world is restrained by ignorance, it does not shine due to negligence;

children.text: jalpābhilepanaṃ brūmi duḥkhaṃ tasya mahad bhayaṃ // Śag_39.2
children.translated_text: I call chatter its covering, suffering is its great fear.

children.text: sravanti sarvataḥ srotāḥ srotasāṃ kiṃ nivāraṇaṃ /
children.translated_text: Streams flow everywhere; what is the restraint of streams?

children.text: srotasāṃ saṃvaraṃ brūhi kena srotaḥ pidhīyate // Śag_39.3
children.translated_text: Tell the restraint of streams; by what is the stream blocked?

children.text: yāni srotāṃsi lokasya smṛtiḥ teṣāṃ nivāraṇaṃ /
children.translated_text: The streams of the world, mindfulness is their restraint;

children.text: srotasāṃ saṃvaraṃ brūmi prajñayā hi pidhīyate // Śag_39.4
children.translated_text: I declare the restraint of streams, for they are indeed closed by wisdom.

children.text: prajñāyāś ca smṛteś caiva nāmarūpasya sarvaśaḥ /
children.translated_text: Of wisdom and mindfulness, and of name and form entirely;

children.text: ācakṣva pṛṣṭa etan me kutraitad uparudhyate // Śag_39.5
children.translated_text: Tell this when asked, where is this obstructed?

children.text: prajñā caiva smṛtiś caiva nāmarūpaṃ ca sarvaśaḥ /
children.translated_text: Wisdom and mindfulness, and name and form entirely;

children.text: vijñānasya nirodhād dhi atraitad uparudhyate // Śag_39.6
children.translated_text: Indeed, through the cessation of consciousness, here this is obstructed.

children.text: kathaṃ smṛtasya carato vijñānam uparudhyate /
children.translated_text: How is consciousness obstructed for one who is mindful in action?

children.text: ācakṣva pṛṣṭa etan me yathātatham asaṃśayaḥ // Śag_39.7
children.translated_text: Tell me this when asked, as it is, without doubt.

children.text: adhyātaṃ ca bahirdhā ca vedanāṃ nābhinandataḥ /
children.translated_text: For one who does not delight in internal and external sensations,

children.text: evaṃ smṛtasya carato vijñānam uparudhyate // Śag_39.8
children.translated_text: Thus, consciousness is obstructed for one who is mindful in action.

body.text: ye ca saṃkhyātadharmāṇo ye ca śaikṣāḥ pṛ

children.text: tha
children.translated_text: tha

children.text: gvidhāḥ /
children.translated_text: gvidhāḥ /

children.text: teṣāṃ me nipakasyeryāṃ pṛṣṭaḥ prabrūhi mārṣa // Śag_39.9
children.translated_text: Tell me, O wise one, the path for them when asked.

children.text: kāmeṣu nābhigṛdhyeta manasānāvilo bhavet /
children.translated_text: One should not be attached to desires, the mind should be unclouded;

children.text: kuśalaḥ sarvadharmeṣu smṛto bhikṣuḥ parivrajet // Śag_39.10
children.translated_text: Skilled in all <s>Dharmas</s>, the mindful monk should wander.

body.translated_text: ye ca saṃkhyātadharmāṇo ye ca śaikṣāḥ pṛ

children.text: arthavargīyeṣu kāmān ārabhya gāthā:
children.translated_text: arthavargīyeṣu kāmān ārabhya gāthā:

children.text: kāmān kāmāyamānasya tasya cet tat samṛdhyati /
children.translated_text: For one desiring desires, if that prospers,

children.text: addhā prītamanā bhavati labdhvā martyo yad īpsitaṃ // Śag_40.1
children.translated_text: Surely, the mortal becomes pleased, having obtained what is desired.

children.text: tasya cet kāmāyamānasya chandajātasya jaṃtunaḥ /
children.translated_text: For that creature, desiring desires, born of longing,

children.text: te kāmāḥ parihīyaṃte śalyaviddha iva rūpyate // Śag_40.2
children.translated_text: Those desires are diminished, like one pierced by a thorn.

children.text: yaḥ kāmāṃ parivarjayati sarpasyeva śirāt padaṃ /
children.translated_text: He who avoids desires like the head of a snake,

children.text: sa imāṃ viṣaktikāṃ loke smṛtaḥ samativartate // Śag_40.3
children.translated_text: He is said to transcend this attachment in the world.

children.text: kṣetravastuhiraṇ@yaṃ ca gavāśvamaṇikuṇḍalaṃ /
children.translated_text: kṣetravastuhiraṇ@yaṃ ca gavāśvamaṇikuṇḍalaṃ /

children.text: striyo dāsān pṛthakkāmān yo naro hy abhigṛdhyati // Śag_40.4
children.translated_text: Women, servants, various desires—if a man covets these,

body.text: abalaṃ vā balīyāṃso mṛdnaṃty enaṃ parisravā

children.text: ḥ
children.translated_text: ḥ

children.text: tata enaṃ duḥkham anveti bhinnāṃ nāvam ivodakaṃ // Śag_40.5
children.translated_text: Then suffering follows him like water in a broken boat.

children.text: yasya tv etat samucchinnaṃ tālamastakavad dhataṃ /
children.translated_text: For whom this is completely cut off, like the top of a palm tree struck down,

children.text: śokās tasya nivartante udabindur iva puṣkarāt // Śag_40.6 (cf. Uv 10.13ab und 3.10cd)
children.translated_text: His sorrows cease like a drop of water from a lotus leaf.

body.translated_text: abalaṃ vā balīyāṃso mṛdnaṃty enaṃ parisravā

children.text: bhadraikarāgāthā (bhadragarātrīya, bhadrakarātriya):
children.translated_text: bhadraikarāgāthā (bhadragarātrīya, bhadrakarātriya):

children.text: atītaṃ nānvāgamayen na pratikāṃkṣed anāgataṃ /
children.translated_text: One should not pursue the past, nor long for the future;

children.text: pratyutpannāś ca ye dharmās tatra tatra vipaśyakaḥ /
children.translated_text: And whatever <s>Dharmas</s> arise presently, there one should be discerning;

children.text: asaṃhāryam asaṃkṣobhyaṃ tad vidvān anubṛṃhayet // Śag_41.1
children.translated_text: The wise should cultivate that which is unshakable and unperturbed.
